snippet: Khaled al-Fawwaz, who was one of Osama bin Laden’s earliest confidants, received the punishment on Friday after his conviction on conspiracy charges in the attacks, which killed 224 people.
abstract: Khaled al-Fawwaz, Saudi member of Osama bin Laden's inner circle, is sentenced to life in prison for participating in global conspiracy to kill United States citizens and for his role in deadly bombings on US embassies in Nairobi, Kenya, and Dar es Salaam, Tanzania.
lead_paragraph: Khaled al-Fawwaz, who was one of Osama bin Laden’s earliest confidants, received the punishment on Friday after his conviction on conspiracy charges in the attacks, which killed 224 people.

headline.main: Bin Laden Aide Sentenced to Life in Prison in 1998 U.S. Embassy Bombings
